Name: crashplanpro
Overview: CrashPlan offers the most comprehensive online backup solution to tens of

userid.Name: User ID
userid.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

groupid.Name: Group ID
groupid.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

umask.Name: Umask
umask.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

niceness(priority).Name: Niceness (priority)
niceness(priority).Description: Priority at which the application should run.  A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions.  Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

displaywidth.Name: Display Width
displaywidth.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

displayheight.Name: Display Height
displayheight.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

secureconnection.Name: Secure Connection
secureconnection.Description: Whether or not an encrypted connection should be used to access the application's GUI.  Set to <i><b>1</b></i> to encrypt the connection.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Note:</b></span> When enabling the secure connection, security parameters needs to be generated.  This <b>one-time</b> operation is done during container startup.  Depending on your system, this could take a few minutes.  GUI of the application won't be available until the operation completes.

extrax11vncoptions.Name: Extra x11vnc Options
extrax11vncoptions.Description: Extra options to pass to the x11vnc server running in the Docker container.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Warning:</b></span> For advanced users. Do not use unless you know what you are doing.

maximummemory.Name: Maximum Memory
maximummemory.Description: Maximum amount of memory the CrashPlan Engine is allowed to use.  One of the following memory unit (case insensitive) should be added as a suffix to the size: <b><i>G</i></b>, <b><i>M</i></b> or <b><i>K</i></b>. By default, when this variable is not set, a maximum of 1024MB (<b><i>1024M</i></b>) of memory is allowed.

configdirectory.Name: Config Directory
configdirectory.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

storage.Name: Storage
storage.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application.<br>Container path: /storage

webportforgui.Name: WEB Port for GUI
webportforgui.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the web interface.<br><b>NOTE:</b> This applies only when <i>Network Type</i> is set to <i>Bridge</i>.  For other network types, port 5800 should be used instead.

vncportforgui.Name: VNC Port for GUI
vncportforgui.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the VNC protocol.  Optional if no VNC client is used.<br><b>NOTE:</b> This applies only when <i>Network Type</i> is set to <i>Bridge</i>.  For other network types, port 5900 should be used instead.
